reviews.review_msg:
Unfair marking when comparison to peers. Picked on certain students and favoured others. 

In an Indigenous cohort she disregarded local information offered by students. 

She left the university giving students two weeks notice without explanation that she would not be continuing with our cohort.

Very tough and not in ways that breed excellence - but in ways that discourage and intimidate students. Unfair marking, inflexible grading (even when the course is supposed to be pass/fail) and denied extensions (with valid documented reasons). Did pass, but was simultaneously under stimulated and felt as if I was failing the entire semester.

Carolyn is truly the best teacher I've ever had. I took her class during PDP and I hope whoever is reading this has the privilege to be in her class. She is so inspirational and truly cares about her students. I'd take every class with her if I could!

Carolyn can be tough, and sometimes a little confusing, but she's a solid prof. She can be very entertaining and helpful, and you'll likely to get along with her. Just be ready to work hard on your assignments and be ready to impress.

Wendi was my FA for EDUC 400. She called several day of meetings, and was accusatory toward me and painted my questions to my teachers in a negative light. She made constant excuses for PDP ITEM and the lack of documentation and preparedness the program had. I am not surprised it was cancelled. Wendi often says one thing, then does another. Beware.

Wendi has not replied to my requests for course outlines for EDUC 400/401 she co-taught. This will cause issues for me when I am evaluated for certification in my home country. She has not replied to emails about adding our names to Colleen's WestCAST presentation so we can get credit for presenting, even though she presented. Not a helpful FA.

Wendi is incredibly militant. When I had concerns about how class was being delivered, she claimed I was not being adaptable to the PDP program. She likes stopping people in the hallway and threatening them with disciplinary meetings if they are unable to attend for health reasons. She loves micromanaging students forcing them to do things her way.

I have never had a single positive conversation with Wendi as my co-teacher. She expects compliance in all things PDP related, and is completely unwilling to compromise on anything. She enabled Colleen in EDUC 400 when several of us had concerns about the lack of preparedness for the ITEM program. An FA should have your back, Wendi does not.

Wendi was the co-teacher for my EDUC 400 class. She constantly made excuses for why EDUC 400 was always running things last minute, and was very condescending whenever I had questions about PDP or how EDUC 400 was run. She expects her students to adapt to her course with no notice, which made class really hard. Bad luck if you get her as your FA.
wonderful guy! would recommend all of his classes.
Greg is truly one of the best there is. Makes every class interesting and gives VERY detailed feedback so you know exactly where and how to improve. Highly highly recommend!

Greg is an amazing prof. He is organized, communicates effectively, and offers great lectures with many opportunities for community building within the classroom, and accessible entry points to connect to each lesson. He also offers so many useful resources with his students! I'm really grateful I took his class.
Greg has been one of my absolute favourite professor's at SFU. He's very caring, kind, and understanding. If you get the chance to take a course with him I would 100% suggest it!

It's a pass/fail course so it's pretty easy by nature, but even by those standards Greg made it so easy, and I was never stressed thanks to his relaxing and laid-back attitude. He is very caring and approachable, definitely hope to take him again in the future.
Great guy, very supportive, genuinely loves people.

This was a pass/fail class (I passed). Although long, Kevin was able to (mostly) keep us all engaged. His honesty about his own biases and experiences helped to facilitate critical and meaningful class discussions. There were occasions where he seemed disorganized, but overall as long as you show up and do the work, you should be fine in his class.

Colleen's Exploration A is very disrespectful to Indigenous peoples, as it asks you to self-insert yourself like an activist rather than show respect. Her encouragement of activism in her class wasted a lot of time that could have been used preparing for PDP ITEM. Perhaps then, people would not have been robbed and hospitalized in Mexico. Avoid.

Colleen is the reason the PDP ITEM program is not running this year. Whenever I had questions about the course, she would always cc someone else rather than answer questions I had directly. We were always running things last minute, and sometimes had extra assignments dropped on us with little notice. Lots of safety and health concerns in Mexico.

You need to go into Education 400 understanding it is a waste of almost $4000. We wasted a week painting rocks for some healing circle, and another week on learning how to be an activist teacher. Colleen put very little effort in preparing our class and PDP ITEM trip. Its no wonder it was cancelled this year after all the safety and health concerns

Everything stated about the disaster of last years ITEM cohort is true with Colleen being at fault. She asked our cohort to present at WestCAST 2025 with her, but only credited herself with presenting, leaving our names out. Despite many emails she has not corrected this, and comes across as very self-interested. She only cares about herself.

Our EDUC 400 class was given to us in bits and pieces. We didn't see our homestays until we got there and were asked to pay over $6000 ahead of any schedule or we would lose our spot. The field school was unsafe, with my peers getting robbed while we were there and another going to hospital. Don't take PDP ITEM with Colleen, not worth the risk.

Colleen expects her students to adapt to her teaching methods, but never adapts to her students. She ran EDUC 400 without a syllabus, schedule or any rubrics for her assignments. Things seemed to be graded on whether you agreed with her views on education or not. The ITEM field school portion was very disorganized and unsafe. Horrible teacher.
One of the best teachers I've ever had. Paula is kind, reasonable, and very knowledgeable about what she teaches. She gives great feedback too so take advantage of that if you need it!

Cher's Exploration A is very disrespectful to Indigenous peoples, as it asks you to self-insert yourself like an activist rather than show respect. I will never understand why she encourages long, drawn-out land acknowledgements. Her encouragement of activism in class wasted a lot of time. Not easy to talk to if you are not an activist teacher.

EDUC 400 is a journey that asks you to think about the type of educator YOU want to be.  The profs can't do that work for you.  Thankfully, Cher is very approachable, caring, and supportive of her students.  She tries her best to connect with everyone in her classes on their level.  Trust the process, and if it isn't working for you... talk to her.

I took Education 400 with Cher this year; we did many of our activities Mundy Park. Many of the activities made no sense, like one time when we were painting rocks for a healing circle. This and many other activities did not help me develop my teaching skills. There is no schedule or syllabus for this course, which made it very difficult. I passed.
